intro: Cakile maritima var. oxycarpa, commonly known as sea rocket, is a coastal plant native to the Mediterranean and Atlantic coasts. It is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its upright growth habit and pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical seed pods. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to saline and windy environments. Its ecological importance includes stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
